parameters.description: If not specified, both blog posts and pages are included.

parameters.description: Includes either the immediate children or decendants of the specified page.

parameters.description: Shows a list of pages returned above the list of contributors.

macros.description: Creates a Table of Contents for headings within the body of the macro.
macros.title: Table of Content Zone

parameters.description: The style of bullet-point applied to each item in the list. Any CSS styles are valid. Examples: disc, circle, square.
parameters.name: style

parameters.description: he amount by which to indent each heading level (in CSS units). Example: 10px
parameters.name: indent

parameters.description: The type of separator used when 'Output Type' is set to 'flat'. Examples: brackets, braces, pipe.
parameters.name: separator

parameters.description: The minimum heading level to report in the TOC. For example, '3' will list headings from 'h3.' onwards, but not 'h1.' or 'h2.'.
parameters.name: minLevel

parameters.description: The maximum heading level to report in the TOC. For example, '4' will list headings up to 'h4.', but not from 'h5.' onwards.
parameters.name: maxLevel

parameters.description: If set, any headings not matching the regular expression are ignored. Example: .*\.[1//2]
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: If set, any headings that match the regular expression are ignored. Example: .*\.[1//2]
parameters.name: exclude

parameters.description: If cleared, the TOC will not be visible when exporting.
parameters.name: printable

parameters.description: If specified, a <div> surrounding the TOC will be output with the specified 'class' attribute. Use CSS styles to customise the look of the TOC.
parameters.name: class

parameters.name: reverse

parameters.description: Restricts the number of items in the table.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: If selected, items whose counts in all columns are zero, are included.
parameters.name: showZeroCounts

parameters.description: The page from which to calculate the contribution-based statistics. If no Page Name and Space(s) are specified, the current page is assumed.
parameters.name: page

parameters.description: Restrict the contribution-based statistics to these labels only. Separate each label with a comma.
parameters.name: labels

parameters.description: Specify the space containing the page or scope of spaces to search. Space keys are case-sensitive. Separate each item with a comma. If no Page Name and Label(s) are specified, all pages from the selected spaces are included.
parameters.name: spaces

parameters.description: If not specified, both blog posts and pages are included.
parameters.name: contentType

parameters.description: Specify the publish date for a blog post. The date format required is: YYYY/MM/DD.
parameters.name: publishDate

parameters.description: Includes either the immediate children or decendants of the specified page.
parameters.name: scope

macros.description: Display a chart
macros.title: Chart

body.description: Content in table or macro format.
body.label: Chart Content

parameters.description: For area, bar and line charts. If set to horizontal, the x-axis will run from top to bottom.
parameters.name: orientation

parameters.description: For bar, line and pie charts. If ticked, the chart data will be rendered at an angle.
parameters.name: 3D

parameters.description: For area and bar charts. If ticked, the chart data series will be stacked.
parameters.name: stacked

parameters.description: If ticked, data points in the chart data will be highlighted with shapes.
parameters.name: showShapes

parameters.description: A value from 0 (transparent) to 100 that determines how opaque the data series are. The defaults are different depending on chart types. For 3D charts, its 75. For stacked area charts, its 50 and for others its 100.
parameters.name: opacity

parameters.description: If set to 'before', the chart data table will be rendered on top of the chart. If 'after', the chart data tablewill be rendered below the chart. The chart data table isnt rendered by default.
parameters.name: dataDisplay

parameters.description: Comma separated list of IDs or numbers (starts from 1) in the macro's body to use as chart data.
parameters.name: tables

parameters.description: Comma separated list of column names or numbers (starts from 1) in the macros body to use as chart data.
parameters.name: columns

parameters.description: If set to 'vertical', whole columns in the chart data table will be used as a series. Otherwise, whole rows will be used.
parameters.name: dataOrientation

parameters.description: Has effect only if the chart is a time series. This defines the format that will be used to read data/time values in the chart data.
parameters.name: dateFormat

parameters.description: Has effect only if the chart is a time series. This defines the granularity of how the chart data is interpreted.
parameters.name: timePeriod

parameters.description: A ISO 639-1 two-letter language code used with 'Country' to form a locale. If specified, the chart macro will try to interpret the chart data in that locale.
parameters.name: language

parameters.description: A ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code used with 'Language' to form a locale. If specified, the chart macro will try to interpret the chart data in that locale.
parameters.name: country

parameters.description: If ticked, the chart macro will try to be more lenient with interpreting slightly out-of-format values in the chart data.
parameters.name: forgive

parameters.description: Comma separated list of colours used to customise category, sections, and series colours.
parameters.name: colors

parameters.description: The link (e.g. ^chart-image.png) to where the generated chart should be saved to or read from.
parameters.name: attachment

parameters.description: Specifies how the generated chart is persisted as attachments. Read documentation for more details
parameters.name: attachmentVersion

parameters.description: The comment on attachment created/updated for the chart
parameters.name: attachmentComment

parameters.description: Has effect only if an attachment is specified. Renders charts as thumbnails.
parameters.name: thumbnail

macros.description: This macro is deprecated. Please use the Confluence panel macro instead.
macros.title: Round Rectangle

parameters.description: Displays wiki content in the space above the main content area between the upper corners
parameters.name: title

parameters.description: Displays wiki content in the space below the main content area between the lower corners
parameters.name: footer

parameters.description: The background color of the content area
parameters.name: bgcolor

parameters.description: Enter a width for the rectangle
parameters.name: width

macros.description: Creates a Table of Contents for the current page based on headings in the page.
macros.title: Table of Contents

parameters.description: The style of bullet-point applied to each item in the list. Any CSS styles are valid. Examples: disc, circle, square.
parameters.name: style

parameters.description: The amount by which to indent each heading level (in CSS units). Example: 10px
parameters.name: indent

parameters.description: The type of separator used when 'Output Type' is set to 'flat'. Examples: brackets, braces, pipe.
parameters.name: separator

parameters.description: The minimum heading level to report in the TOC. For example, '3' will list headings from 'h3.' onwards, but not 'h1.' or 'h2.'.
parameters.name: minLevel

parameters.description: The maximum heading level to report in the TOC. For example, '4' will list headings up to 'h4.', but not from 'h5.' onwards.
parameters.name: maxLevel

parameters.description: If set, any headings not matching the regular expression are ignored. Example: .*\.[1//2]
parameters.name: include

parameters.description: If set, any headings that match the regular expression are ignored. Example: .*\.[1//2]
parameters.name: exclude

parameters.description: If cleared, the TOC will not be visible when printing.
parameters.name: printable

parameters.description: If specified, a <div> surrounding the TOC will be output with the specified 'class' attribute. Use CSS styles to customise the look of the TOC.
parameters.name: class

parameters.description: If checked, the links in the table of contents will be full URLs
parameters.name: absoluteUrl
